{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents mention that sunlight, particularly its UVB component, is thought to be the most important environmental factor for the oncogenesis of melanoma. It also mentions that strong evidence implicates sunlight as a cause of skin cancer, including melanoma and basal cell carcinoma. Squamous cell carcinoma also appears to be related more strongly to total exposure to the sun. Therefore, sunlight can be an etiological cause for all three types of skin cancer: squamous cell carcinoma, malignant melanoma, and basal cell carcinoma. However, there is no mention of sunlight being a cause for port-wine stain, which is a type of birthmark.", "answer_choice": "A. Squamous cell carcinoma, B. Malignant melanoma, C.
